metadata.title: CVE-2021-23993 on Ubuntu 16.04 LTS (xenial) - medium
metadata.description: An attacker may perform a DoS attack to prevent a user from sendingencrypted email to a correspondent. If an attacker creates a craftedOpenPGP key with a subkey that has an invalid self signature, and theThunderbird user imports the crafted key, then Thunderbird may try to usethe invalid subkey, but the RNP library rejects it from being used, causingencryption to fail. This vulnerability affects Thunderbird < 78.9.1.

criterions.comment: thunderbird: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
